page.title: 04 CLUBS IN SAPPERTON
page.content: Years ago before television villagers enjoyed entertaining themselves. They acted good plays in the new Village Hall and did Morris Dancing. After television, however, most people stayed in to watch it. Recently many people wanted to start clubs and groups again. In Sapperton a Youth Club meets each Friday. On Sundays a group of 12 children meet in the school. A playgroup for 12 pre school toddlers is held in the Hall on Mondays and Wednesdays. A church based group called Link Club meets once a month at Rodmarton for the children of Sapperton and Coates as well. Old people go to the Good Companions at Coates. Some also go to Coates W.I. and to Oakridge Cricket Club.
